result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Peter A Idsvoog was found guilty of OWI (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $2,400.00 * PLUS costs and surcharges.  Bail to apply.  Balance of costs as part of supervision.

superMiscConds.notes: AODA assessment, treatment if needed.  Absolute sobriety.

superTimeConds.notes: To speak with others who have addiction issues.

supervisions.notes: From today's date  with $60.00 reinstatement fee.
Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and DRiver Safety Plan signed and filed.

Provide DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Peter A Idsvoog

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers.  ALSO SCRAM.
  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Peter A Idsvoog in court with attorney Jonathan E Lavoy.  Defendant Peter A Idsvoog in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WITKOWIAK, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing TO ACCOMODATE DEFENSE ATTORNEY.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
